The Open API Initiative (OAI) Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Conference Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI

(4) A Brief History of OAI & OpenAPI

  • Started out in 2011 as Swagger [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Swagger_(software)]
  • Swagger was renamed to OpenAPI at the beginning of 2016
    • Donated to the OpenAPI Initiative (OAI) [https://www.openapis.org/] (part of the Linux Foundation [https://www.linuxfoundation.org/])
    • Swagger [https://swagger.io/tools/open-source/] now refers to a specific tool offered by SmartBear [https://smartbear.com/]
  • OpenAPI has been the official name since 2016
    • OpenAPI 2.0 [https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v2.0.html] was the name after the rename (it's the same as Swagger 2.0)
    • OpenAPI 3.0 [https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.0.4.html] was released in July 2017
    • OpenAPI 3.1 [https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.1.1.html] was released in February 2021
    • OpenAPI 3.2 [https://spec.openapis.org/oas/v3.2.0.html] was released in September 2025


The Open API Initiative (OAI) Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Conference Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI

(12) More Tools



APIs and AI: A Possible Path Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Conference Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI

(13) Model Context Protocol (MCP)

  • MCP is the current standard protocol for LLM consumers
  • The initial focus was on additional and extended context
    • Additional context by providing access to the environment
    • Extended context by allowing MCP servers to externally manage context
  • Many mapping tools generate MCP servers from OpenAPI descriptions
  • What to expose and how to design it is out of scope


APIs and AI: A Possible Path Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Conference Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI

(14) Anthropic Advanced Tool Use

Source: "Introducing advanced tool use on the Claude Developer Platform", November 24, 2025



APIs and AI: A Possible Path Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Conference Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI

(15) MCP Solves Everything!?

  • Problem #1: Complex APIs will overload the MCP client's context
  • Problem #2: Larger API landscapes will overload the MCP client's context
  • Problem #3: Poor API design translates to poor MCP results
  • Problem #4: Bad AX results in unsatisfactory AI results


APIs and AI: A Possible Path Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Conference Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI

(16) More Tools ⇏ Better Tool Landscape

  • LLMs can now access many tools
  • But they cannot understand many of them well
  • Poor descriptions → poor tool selection → poor results
  • Next: Better Described Tools [Better Described Tools (1)]


APIs and AI: A Possible Path Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Conference Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI

(17) Better Described Tools



APIs and AI: A Possible Path Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Conference Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI

(18) Better Descriptions ⇏ Scalable Tool Use

  • Better AX reduces confusion and misuse
  • But even well-described tools still overload agent context
  • The problem shifts from understanding tools to finding the right ones
  • Next: Dynamic Tool Discovery [Dynamic Tool Discovery (1)]


APIs and AI: A Possible Path Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Conference Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI

(19) Dynamic Tool Discovery



APIs and AI: A Possible Path Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Conference Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI

(20) Dynamic Discovery ⇏ Ideal Tool Landscape

  • Discovery helps reduce tool overload
  • Agents still have to invent workflows from scratch
  • We need higher-level, business-aligned tools
  • Next: Workflow-Based Tools [Workflow-Based Tools (1)]


APIs and AI: A Possible Path Erik Wilde: OpenAPI Conference Welcome and OpenAPI in the Age of AI
